definition: underground palace (as part of imperial tomb)
-ly/structural particle: used before a verb or adjective, linking it to preceding modifying adverbial adjunct
palace/temple/castration (as corporal punishment)/first note in pentatonic scale

sentences.english: No wonder people said this hotel was pushy and bullying. But, how was this possible?
sentences.chinese: 难怪人家说地宫酒店嚣张跋扈，可是，怎么可能呢？

sentences.english: We defined the existence of the underground palace and its location.
sentences.chinese: 据此亦明确了地宫的大致位置。

sentences.english: Some scholars believe that the whole of basement was rendered as a mandala.
sentences.chinese: 有人认为法门寺地宫构成一个完整的蔓荼罗。

sentences.english: Wow, there is an underground palace?
Because of this underground palace, the pagoda is called the Wanfo (10,000-Buddha) Gold Pagoda.
sentences.chinese: 所以这座地宫就被叫做万佛金塔地宫。

sentences.english: Because of this underground palace, the pagoda is called the Wanfo (10,000-Buddha) Gold Pagoda.
sentences.chinese: 所以这座地宫就被叫做万佛金塔地宫。

sentences.english: While clearing the stupa foundation, the underground palace was accidentally discovered.
sentences.chinese: 在清理塔基时，意外发现了地宫。

sentences.english: These precious ancient books were preserved in the temple's basement.
sentences.chinese: 这些珍贵的古籍都保存在寺庙的地宫里面。

sentences.english: So the real underground palace is still unavailable for us to see.
sentences.chinese: 所以真正的皇陵地宫我们现在是看不到的。

definition: path leading to a grave/tomb passage/aisle leading to the coffin chamber of an ancient tomb
a room for keeping sth hidden/secret room/hidden chamber
main hall of a Buddhist temple
the tomb of the First Emperor at Mt Li 驪山|骊山[Li2 shan1] near Xi'an (awaits excavation)
